summary: This is an email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) containing a link to a WNYC Studios article titled 'How Julie Brown Broke Open the Jeffrey Epstein Story' and includes standard public affairs office contact information. The email subject references Alec Baldwin.

persons.name: Julie Brown
persons.context: She is the journalist who broke open the Jeffrey Epstein story, as referenced in the linked WNYC Studios article.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is the central subject of the story that Julie Brown broke open.

persons.name: Alec Baldwin
persons.context: His name is referenced in the subject line of the email ('Here's the Thing w/Alec Baldwin'), though his connection to the Epstein story in this document is not specified.

events.title: Email with Epstein Story Link
events.description: An email is sent from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York containing a link to an article about Julie Brown breaking the Jeffrey Epstein story.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is an email dated June 18, 2019, from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The email contains a link to a WNYC Studios article detailing how journalist Julie Brown broke the Jeffrey Epstein story.
The email subject line references Alec Baldwin, though the body does not explain this connection.
The document shows the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York circulating media about the Epstein case.
